translations.name: Portions of the Bible in Jalapa de Díaz Mazatec
Jamiltepec Mixtec 1983 Edition
translations.description: Jamiltepec Mixtec is a language of Mexico spoken by 9,760 people according to an INALI survey in 2000, with 1,300 monolingual speakers. Jamiltepec Mixtec is also known as Eastern Jamiltepec-San Cristobal Mixtec, Mixteco de Jamiltepec, Mixteco de Oaxaca de Costa Central Baja, and Mixteco de Santa María Huazolotitlán.  © 1983, Wycliffe Bible Translators, Inc.

translations.name: Tuhun cha sañahá ra Jesucristo chi yo
The New Testament in Guerrero Nahuatl
translations.description:
Guerrero Nahuatl is a language of Mexico. Alternate names for Guerrero Nahuatl are Guerrero Aztec, Mexicano de Guerrero, Náhuatl de Guerrero, and Xalitla Nahuatl. There are 125,000 speakers, as of 2000, of this variety of Nahuatl. All variants of Nahuatl combined amount to 1,740,000 speakers. 
                                          © 1987, Wycliffe Bible Translators, Inc.

translations.name: In yencuic iyectlajtoltzin Dios itech ica toTeco Jesucristo
Stiidxa Dios didxazá (El Nuevo Testamento de nuestro señor Jesucristo en el Zapoteco del Istmo)
